title: free small x-height humanist venetian serif fonts
content:
Hello All,

I am looking for a free small x-height serif font that has the minimum printing space usage characteristics of Linden Hill but is a regular serif and not a slab serif.

I would also like to know if it is possible to design fonts using a computer instead of manually drawing them on a drawing board. If it is, what are some good application programs to use to design fonts.

Thanks for any feedback you can provide.

Jim Williams
author: tenntexjlw

comments.content:
You could purchase FontLab, and after a fairly steep learning curve, produce professional quality fonts.  
For simple fonts there is an online program called FontStrut [http://fontstruct.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317184551/http:/fontstruct.com/ "http://fontstruct.com/")  
For a free program that can produce good quality fonts you might consider FontForge. You might start by reading the wiki article about the program [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FontForge](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317184551/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FontForge "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FontForge")  
If you are familiar with Adobe Illustrator, it can be used to design fonts.  
Don
